Package com.sixbank.notificationlibrary.shared.events

Class NotificationFailedEvent

java.lang.Object
com.sixbank.notificationlibrary.shared.events.base.BaseEvent
com.sixbank.notificationlibrary.shared.events.NotificationFailedEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
DomainEvent
public class NotificationFailedEvent extends BaseEvent
Domain event fired when a notification delivery attempt fails.

This event contains details about the failure, including the channel, provider, error messages and codes, timestamps, retry attempt info, and the scheduled time for the next retry (if any).

Usage Example:

 NotificationFailedEvent event = new NotificationFailedEvent(
     "notif-1234",
     "customer-5678",
     ChannelType.SMS,
     "Twilio",
     "Network timeout",
     "TIMEOUT_001",
     Instant.now(),
     2,
     true,
     Instant.now().plusSeconds(60 * 5)
 );

This event can be used to trigger alerts, update dashboards, or schedule retries for failed notification deliveries.

  • Constructor Details

    • NotificationFailedEvent

      public NotificationFailedEvent(String notificationId, String customerId, ChannelType channelType, String provider, String errorMessage, String errorCode, Instant failedAt, int attemptNumber, boolean willRetry, Instant nextRetryAt)
      Constructs a NotificationFailedEvent with failure details.
      Parameters:
      notificationId - Unique identifier for the notification (aggregateId).
      customerId - Identifier for the customer targeted by the notification.
      channelType - The delivery channel (e.g., SMS, EMAIL).
      provider - The external service or provider used for delivery.
      errorMessage - Description of the failure.
      errorCode - Error code returned by the provider or system.
      failedAt - Timestamp when the failure occurred.
      attemptNumber - The number of delivery attempts so far.
      willRetry - Flag indicating if the system plans to retry delivery.
      nextRetryAt - Scheduled time for the next retry attempt; null if no retry planned.
